DOC.brief_summary: The underlying basis of carpal tunnel syndrome and the basis of its increased incidence in diabetes are unknown. The aim of this study was to quantified pathology in an uncompressed nerve (posterior interosseous nerve in the forearm between diabetic and non-diabetic patients with CTS.
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Diagnosis of carpal tunnel syndrome based in clinical history and symptoms Confirmed by nerve conduction studies Exclusion Criteria Other focal nerve entrapments Cervical radiculopathy Inflammatory joint disease Renal failure Thyroid disorders Previous wrist fracture Longterm exposure to vibrating tools Age under 18
